bibl.title: Letter from Raymond O. Dart to Philip Showalter Hench, March 30, 1948

div1.p: Dart informs Hench which items from his collection they would like for the exhibit at the Fourth International Congress of Tropical Diseases. The central panel of the exhibit will be Cornwell's painting, “The Conquerors of Yellow Fever.” A search has been instituted in the Surgeon General's Library for translations of Finlay's papers.

div1.head: Letter from Raymond O. Dart to Philip Showalter Hench, March 30, 1948
div1.opener:
ADDRESS ALL COMMUNICATIONS TO THE DIRECTOR
AIP 001.2
MEDEM
DEPARTMENT OF PATHOLOGY
AMERICAN REGISTRY OF PATHOLOGY
ARMY INSTITUTE OF PATHOLOGY
7TH STREET AND INDEPENDENCE AVENUE SW
WASHINGTON 25, D. C.
30 March 1948
RAS/vws
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM
ARMY MEDICAL ILLUSTRATION SERVICE
Philip S. Hench, M. D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you very much for your very generous reply to our re-
quest for material for the Walter Reed Memorial Exhibit.

Items 3, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 14, 15, 19, 20, 23, 24,
25, 36, 41, 44, 45, 48 and 60, checked on your list, which we are
returning as requested in your letter, are the items which we feel
best answer our needs. If you feel that our selection of material
will not adequately reflect Dr. Carlos J. Finlay's contributions,
your additional suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

In answer to your specific request about space and time, we
plan a total of 65 square feet of show space; 13 square feet in a
horizontal aluminum case, 2'x61/2'x30" high, and 52 square feet of ver-
tical space, consisting of two, 21/2'x4' cases and two, 4'x4' cases.
As the display is planned as a memorial exhibit, it was hoped that the
placement of all documents, medals, etc., in the cases could be com-
pleted on the evening of 9 May, so as to be ready for the opening of
the Congress at 8:00 A.M., on 10 May. This is in keeping with instruc-
tions issued by the Committee on Exhibits of the Fourth International
Congress of Tropical Diseases which state “all exhibits must be com-
pleted by 8:00 A.M., May 10 and remain intact until 2:00 P.M., May 15.”

Mr. S. F. Law of Wyeth, Incorporated, has graciously consented
to send us the Dean Cornwell picture, “Conquerors of Yellow Fever.” It
is planned to use this famous picture as a central panel of the exhibit.

Search has been instituted in The Surgeon General's Library
for the English translations of the “collection of Dr. Carlos J. Finlay.”
It is a privilege to be of help in this matter. Information will be
transmitted to you as soon as it becomes available.

Your assistance in making this Walter Reed Memorial Exhibit
for the Fourth International Congress of Tropical Diseases a success
is very greatly appreciated.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, RAYMOND O. DART
Colonel, Medical Corps
